para.text: Draw a new polygon

para.text: Select the appropriate drawing mode.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Click with the mouse on the drawing to determine the starting point of the polygon and then release the mouse button again. Now click on the next desired corner point of the polygon and release the mouse button. This is how you create your polygon using any number of corner points.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: To end the polygon drawing, click once on the

para.text: mouse button. The polygon is automatically closed. You can now start a new polygon or switch directly back to standard mode by clicking the

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: mouse button again.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The polygon is initially always created with the preset properties for an area (outline and filling).

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: If you have selected the polygon mode but have not yet started drawing, you can change these preset properties here directly.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: When you select a polygon, you can use the

link.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:underline; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: to change its size, shape and direction of rotation at any time. With the

link.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:underline; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: you can move all nodes of the polygon. So you can easily change the polygon later.

para.text: You can also create new additional nodes at a later date. For this, there is a so-called

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: virtual node

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: in the middle of each line segment, shown as a blue circle. If you click on it and move it, this virtual node becomes a new real node. So you can interactively expand your line with new nodes.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: You can also remove individual nodes. To do this,

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: right-click

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: on a node. Then you get a small menu in which you can remove the node, among other things.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Change the properties of polygons

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: If you select a polygon, you can set its properties in the properties panel on the right edge of the window. You can also select several polygons at the same time and thus change their properties together.
